senses.sense_definition: A person who secretly follows or tracks someone else, often for surveillance purposes.

examples.text: The detective realized the <w>tailer</w> had been following him for several blocks.
She tried to lose her <w>tailer</w> by suddenly turning into a busy shopping mall.

senses.sense_definition: A crew member on a boat responsible for pulling and holding the ropes (sheets or halyards) while another operates the winch.

examples.text: The <w>tailer</w> worked in perfect sync with the grinder to trim the sails quickly.
Modern winches often have self-tailing mechanisms, reducing the need for a dedicated <w>tailer</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A tool consisting of a long handle and a noose, used to secure a fish by its tail.

examples.text: The guide used a <w>tailer</w> to land the salmon without harming it.
He reached for the <w>tailer</w> as the large fish tired and came near the boat.

senses.sense_definition: A fish that is feeding on the bottom in shallow water with its tail visible above the surface.

examples.text: The angler cast his line carefully toward the <w>tailer</w> on the flats.
Spotting a <w>tailer</w> is exciting because it means the fish is actively feeding.
